item.title: US, China seek to avoid trade war escalation, salvage Trump-Xi meeting in Malaysia talks
item.description: Top economic officials from the US and China will face off in Kuala Lumpur on Saturday to try to avert an escalation of their trade war and ensure that a meeting happens next week between US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping. The talks on the sidelines of the Association of S

item.title: Thailand's Queen Mother Sirikit, influential style icon, dies at 93
item.description: Thailand's Queen Mother Sirikit, who brought glamour and elegance to a postwar revival in the country's monarchy and who, in later years, would occasionally wade into politics, has died aged 93, the Thai Royal Household Bureau said on Saturday. Sirikit had been out of the public eye since a stroke

item.title: Hilsa fishing ban ends: Fishermen in Chandpur set to return to rivers
item.description: After a 22-day government ban, the Meghna and Padma rivers are set to come alive once again with the sound of boats and nets being cast, as nearly 43,000 fishermen in Chandpur prepare to resume hilsa fishing from Saturday midnight. item.title: Capturing cosmic beauty with a mobile phone
item.description: Does the night sky ever gaze at us? Does the Milky Way Galaxy ever want to reveal its presence by radiating its light? item.title: Lessons from Central African Republic
item.description: The history of human civilization is more, or less, the cronicle of war and conflicts through the ages, inter-state or intra-state. item.title: Menacing proliferation of three-wheelers in Dhaka City
item.description: The proliferation of auto-rickshaws has reached the tipping point where their earlier version of pedal rickshaws is on the verge of vanishing from the scene. item.title: Retired officials from 25 BCS cadres demand retrospective promotion, citing discrimination
item.description: Retired officials from 25 Bangladesh Civil Service (BCS) cadres -- all except the administration cadre -- have demanded promotions and equal benefits, alleging discrimination in government service. They also called for an ordinance based on key recommendations of the Public Administration Reform C
